website_summaries.verdict: Best choice for a trivia party;  fast-paced and good for groups.
pros: Customers praise how fun this is, especially for teens and adults, but the questions are appropriate for most ages
In addition to being a clever party game with challenging but fun questions, this game also stands out for being a good value for the cost
cons: A few felt some of the trivia questions were obscure, and some thought it was hard to keep the cards organized

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun Trivia Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a clever little trivia game. I imagine it would be even more fun with more than 2 people, but since my husband and I have 4 young kids (read: no friends), it's just been the 2 of us playing. It's fine though, no big deal. *silent cry*
customer_reviews.author: BlovesH

customer_reviews.title: Over in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: With 4 people playing, this game was over in 10 minutes. The questions are ridiculously simple, and with the number of spaces you can move per turn, you can easily go from Start --> Finish within 4 or 5 rounds. We tried doubling up and going around the board twice, but were bored of it by the time it got to the end. There's no room for creativity or joking. You know the answer or you don't, and calling out a wrong answer (say for laughs) voids your turn. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Teacup Squid

customer_reviews.title: Mostly trivia.
customer_reviews.text: We like this game, but it's not quite as much fun as I thought it would be. I was under the assumption everyone yelled out answers until someone got the right answer... like in charades... but you only get one guess in this game, per turn. I suppose you can opt to change the rules... maybe we'll try that next time... to make it more 'party' like. That being said, it's mostly a trivia game... so if you like trivia you'll probably like this game.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodora M Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Fun for teens for sure!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! My teenage son truly gets a kick out of playing it with his friends. They laugh a ton while they play it. Not sure if it is because they get to 'legally use the word a&&' while they play it. Anyway - this is one of the better games I have purchased lately and for the price you cannot beat it just to have in your game closet to play once in a while at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: ... my husband and me to bond in a family fun way with my 21 year old step son and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and me to bond in a family fun way with my 21 year old step son and his girlfriend. We played it last night and was I was pleased that that the "kids" enjoyed it so much they didn't want the game to end. It brought back warm memories of playing Monopoly with my Dad and brother for hours growing up. The game gives everyone a chance to get a few questions right and interact with loved ones in a time honored tradition of playing a board game at a kitchen counter. In today's world, that is priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Likited re-playability. Fun easy game for most ages kids to adults.
customer_reviews.text: Good game but you will grow to memorize the ratings which removed the fun. My kids had half the deck pretty well down after 3-4 times through. Some of the ratings are a bit silly and well over or under rated. Overall an easy to play game just don't expect much re-playability. Not worth it at msrp but if you catch it on sale pick it up for easy to play party games. Not as fun as apples to apples or cards against humanity.
customer_reviews.author: Bovineplane

customer_reviews.title: Super fun Game for Everyone
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot of fun. A few typos on the cards in my opinion. They do not differentiate between "Actress" and "Actor" which makes a difference. We allow the question asker to figure that out and state which gender. There's a toss up about having to state the entire given name of a person, or if "Beethoven" would have been an acceptable answer. Despite little things you'll have to figure out house rules with, it's an addicting game.
customer_reviews.author: WebErika

customer_reviews.title: Very fun family game!
customer_reviews.text: The greatest part of this game is that you're always playing. One player reads the cards and everyone else answers the question. The fastest answer wins! It's got creative and fun questions and keeps you interested the entire time. Not everyone is super good at the game, but it can be played by almost anyone. Get's even crazier with teams!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: A must have for game night
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. It has been a family favorite for years. It is a fairly unique trivia game in which clues are slowly revealed until someone guesses the answer— a person, a place, or a thing. Very underrated game that is great for families and adults. There have even been a few expansions added to liven up gameplay. My one very small critique is that I liked the original artwork for the board better than the new design. I understand why they made the change to a less suggestive image, but I had always enjoyed the campy vibe of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Good trivia game
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit on the fence about this game., I really like the questions, which are a variety of trivia style questions that would be a great primer for Jeopardy. However, the board game component is pretty weak. I feel like they could have done something more with that part of the game. Having said that, the trivia or knowledge part of the game is challenging and fun, so overall it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DesignDiva9

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to Boring Boardgames
customer_reviews.text: We played this at a family cabin getaway, the players 30-60 years old, and we loved it. It was a welcome change to the boring board games we usually play. The topics reminded me of a much simpler Jeopardy, so no PhDs required. Replay would suffer after many plays as you'll recognize the clues, but there enough cards for that to take a while. Our group of six took about 30-45 minutes to complete the game, then we played another round. The game was a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This game is super fun! I would consider myself smart and educated, however many of the questions are definitely on the difficult side which makes the game more entertaining. You will definitely learn a lot! There are a ton of questions so this game will never get stale! Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Loveit

customer_reviews.title: So much fun for a cheaper game
customer_reviews.text: We have played with several groups of adults and like it. Nice that they are quick (about 15-20 min) games that you can play as many or little time as you like. Also great that with the clues everyone has a chance. I am not good at normal trivia, but with this format, I am as good as the next player.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hart

customer_reviews.title: The New Best Trivia Game
customer_reviews.text: This a great trivia game for the whole family. Even the grandparents enjoyed playing Smart Ass. Don't let the name cause you to think twice about the purchase. It is clean and fun entertainment. It should be everyone's new favorite trivia game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FUNNY FUNNY! Played with 11 year old thru 60 ...
customer_reviews.text: FUNNY FUNNY! Played with 11 year old thru 60 and had a blast. 4 hours of sitting on the floor laughing! (Im too old for that!) Even visiting friends from another country (non native English speaking) had fun playing. I recommend for a group of 6-8 to make it fun. Great for family get together
customer_reviews.author: Shell 1972

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun on game night!
customer_reviews.text: We do game nights about once a month. This one is a lot of fun. Not for the younger ones as I don't think they'd know the answers. It's easy to set up and there's not much of a learning curve when it comes to figuring out how to play. It's nice because everyone plays at the same time. A real crowd pleaser on game night!
customer_reviews.author: Solaurie

customer_reviews.title: Knowledge is needed!
customer_reviews.text: Love this game for game nights, it’s defiantly easy to learn how to play. It just depends on if the game itself is easy or not by the knowledge you have. There’s definitely cards that a easy for kids and adults but some are harder for kids. There’s a card section for geography and that’s always a tougher section in my opinion but the other sections like character and items are good for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoyed this game. It is easy to play and fun for all ages. We played with a combination of teenagers, middle aged, and senior aged players and everybody had a great time. We played several games and everyone was able to participate with no generation gap issues. Even though there are plenty of question cards included in this game, I would recommend adding the expansion/ travel pack to your order because once you start playing you will want to keep playing.
customer_reviews.author: dorsey3

customer_reviews.title: Not so fun game
customer_reviews.text: I thought this game way going to be way different- like maybe everyone writing funny, smart alec responses. However, it was not that. There are tons of weird rules & other things that i dont think are fun. I am returning my game.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Really fun
customer_reviews.text: Best party game I've played since cards against humanity although different. Not at all like boring trivial pursuit
customer_reviews.author: C.E. Aylett

customer_reviews.title: Great trivia-based game that will never get old!
customer_reviews.text: This game is an absolute blast! But don't let the seemingly easy premise stop you from buying. The cards and hints given are harden then they appear. The "What Am I" category is the easiest, and in fact, "Hard Ass" questions aren't all that hard either. But my group of friends came to fear the "Who Am I" category, which is the most difficult. The group would groan every time orange was rolled. Lots of fun can be had with this game as you race your friends toward the donkey's butt for the title! Gather your trivia-loving adults friends and play the night away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as it sounds
customer_reviews.text: Played the game once. No real desire to play again. Wasn’t that fun. Wish I would have got another game.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle1

customer_reviews.title: Not enough game cards
customer_reviews.text: This game is really fun!! However, it's easy to go through the whole game cards within two 1 hours game sessions of four people. It would be nice if there was an option for more cards to be purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Trivia Game
customer_reviews.text: Overall nothing special about this trivia game that would leave me recommending it. It's just basic trivia, they throw the "Ass" in there to make it sound more creative and fun than it actually is. Played once and given to the GoodWill.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Good Trivia Game for All
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for a bunch of people who can't agree on what to play and are not real gamers. Its a fairly easy trivia game but the rules make it more interesting. With the exception of the People category, I would think 15yos could play this game w/o problem. I tend to play this in a group of 5 people, the only problem is that they don't provide enough trivia cards. I have probably played the game 6 times and we've gone through them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Trezza

customer_reviews.title: great game!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I'd say the game is appropriate for ages 12+. There are some pretty hard questions in there that I can't even answer! It's fun though. Very easy to learn and a great addition to game night.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer E

customer_reviews.title: Best trivia game ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is not your normal trivia game. This beats Trivial Pursuit by a mile easily. Fun and fast paced with lots of laughs. Everyone we have played this game with loves it and most have gone out and bought their own. I highly recommend this game!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Culler

customer_reviews.title: My kids thought it was ridiculous :)
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I got this for half price on a deal, it says 12 and up but we laughed so hard because no one could figure these out! If you want a game that takes a lot of brainpower for adults it would be good. For teenagers not so much!
customer_reviews.author: angela davis

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have waited my entire life for a game where I don't ha e to wait my turn! I have lost games waiting for my turn. We have always played board games and I bought this for my mother's and my birthday. We had the best time playing this game!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Fun Family Game
customer_reviews.text: We played right away and everyone loved it, my 9 year old didn't get as many chances to answer and roll the dice due to the questions being a little hard for her to answer but she enjoyed it anyway. More geared for ages noted in description but slightly younger will enjoy. Questions are both challenging and easy. All around great family game.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous game for adults of all ages and skills
customer_reviews.text: Friends invited us to play this game at their house and we enjoyed it so much we bought one for ourselves. We've played it several tiems when friends have visited - usually while drinking adult beverages. Everyone LOVES the game. It is fun for people of all talents and has a ix if questions on a wide variety fo topics to make it enjoyable for all.
customer_reviews.author: Davekv

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a family fun fast moving game that every player gets to participate. It can be played with as few as 2 players but we have found more than 2 is better and 6 players is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Received Torn and dented
customer_reviews.text: Although the game itself is great, I bought it as a gift and when the gift receiver opened the perfectly fine amazon box, the actual game box was dented and torn which means that it was placed into the shipping box like that!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great to take to college!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trivia game to play/ buy before you go to college! Having board games to play in college is going to be a really great way to make friends, and this is one of the funnest games I’ve ever played with my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Jada Commodore

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Lots of fun with friends.
customer_reviews.text: I really Like these smart games. They are really fun for older people. The I have you need to know your history. They have different subject games. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Smart-ass suggests it's a game about people who ARE a smart-ass. But, it's actually about being SMART. Not what my family considers fun. Might as well play Trivial Pursuit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my mom for her birthday. We had a lot of fun playing it with the whole family. We normally play a lot of board games as a family and this game is definitely in our top 3 games now! Try it with your family! It’ll have you cracking up!
customer_reviews.author: S2kc

customer_reviews.title: FUN FACTS GAME
customer_reviews.text: THIS GAME IS REALLY EASY TO LEARN AND FUN. MOVES QUICKLY. HAS SOME INTERESTING FACTS ON THE CARDS FOR YOU TO THINK OF TOO. WHO AM I ? WHERE AM I ? ETC. FUN!! FUN!!!
customer_reviews.author: denise breaux

customer_reviews.title: Can only play for a little while.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this game so much that we played it all the time, but once you get through all the cards once you can't really play it anymore. Still I think there are extensions out there and it's pretty cheap, I definitely think it was worth it for us for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game is pretty fun if you like to shout out the answers
customer_reviews.text: This game is pretty fun if you like to shout out the answers. One person reads the clues one by one and if you think you know the answer the person shouts it out. If they're wrong then they can't guess anymore and the reader continues on with the next clue. Some of them are quite difficult and I just ended up waiting until everyone guessed, got it wrong, and then I would listen to the rest of the clues and by the last clue I would be able to answer.
customer_reviews.author: Davion

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun, rounds are very quick and we find ourselves blurting out wrong answers constantly. Fun trivia game would recommend for teenagers and adults!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A super fun gift for anyone who likes Trivia
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as Christmas gift for a Trivia lover. Have not actually played the game yet but when he opened it at the Christmas party, everyone split out in laughter because of the packaging and name of the game. A super fun gift for anyone who likes Trivia.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Donna

customer_reviews.title: terrific game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a blast! Great for family or friends game nights. Pick it up, you won't regret it. would make a great gift for young and old, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Will R

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative to Trivial Pursuit
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing games with my family and this is a great addition to all the games I've played before. You don't have to be a trivia nut ether to enjoy it (like Trivial Pursuit or instance). Good for most ages and the topics very widely so you don't have to be an expert in any one and most everyone can enjoy it and play along.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great for family gatherings
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game for an informal group. I frequently take it along when visiting family and friends. Definitely follow the age guidelines, the questions would be too difficult for most kids. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: FrankW

customer_reviews.title: Fun Trivia Game With A Few Twists!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game night game!! If you like Trivia type games you will enjoy this. Same basic answer questions move forward - but with a few twists in landing on gonback three spaces spots or getting bonus questions. It’s fun it’s worth giving it a try !!
customer_reviews.author: Little Person,Big Heart

customer_reviews.title: Good for all groups!
customer_reviews.text: This game has proved to be a huge success in almost any circle. We have loved playing it with our friends and co-workers alike. Don't be put off by the name, the game is clean and fun for the whole family! It is also somewhat different than your typical trivia game because every player only gets one guess so you can't just spout off answers willy nilly, you have to wait for the right clue so that you are sure of your answer, but then what if someone else says it before you? Oh no! It's a great game and the smartest people don't always win.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A Trivia Game That's a Blast and can Benefit Those with less Knowledge
customer_reviews.text: This was a big hit at one of my part games. It was pretty amazing how so many of us knew so much about some topics and so little about others. Those of us who think we are smart asses are too egotistical to wait for the easier hints, and those who are less smart ass wind up benefiting. It's a good range of niche knowledge vs. pieces many of us know. And while it looks like it will be a short game, if you have a lot of people, several of the pieces wind up not moving for several rounds. It takes time, and we played it twice in one evening. There's proof for you
customer_reviews.author: Tanya McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Have not played game yet. Box came wrapped in plastic. When going to set up game for first use, discovered pieces were missing. The game is supposed to include 6 playing piece stands, and only 3 were included. The stands are used to make your playing piece stand upright, as you move along the board. A little disappointed that purchased a brand new game, and already missing 3 pieces. Hope the game is fun!
customer_reviews.author: Marc A. Villella

customer_reviews.title: Answer Smart Ass bonus questions if you land on that space
customer_reviews.text: Trivia game. Answer Smart Ass bonus questions if you land on that space. Wish it was longer. A couple good rolls and you finished the game. We ended up just asking each other the trivia without rolling or using the board. Still a hoot!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for everyone- tests your GK
customer_reviews.text: This is really fun game. it will test your general knowledge in all aspects. The questions are from all fields and era. The instructions are simple and it can last for 2-3 hours. Fun especially in parties.
customer_reviews.author: Piyush

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun game.
customer_reviews.text: We usually don't keep score when we play this. It can be a very fast paced game...so something good to do if you don't want to spend hours. I like that everyone can yell out stuff at the same time. Makes it more fun.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Fun - better for bigger groups
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ladies group's game night. It plays better when there are more people & everyone gets into the game. When it's a smaller group, it still works, but you just think about how much more fun it would be with a few more people. I would also say this is more for adults then it would be for teens. My teens were good sports, but there were any number of questions that went over their heads. I would say it's good for 20 & over - not for any content - but for a base of knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: ChefCVG

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Fun for all ages! We include this on grown up game night with margaritas and family nights with my 12 year old and her older sister. I’m really surprised how much my youngest enjoys this. It’s a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: So funny! We wanted a cool board game for our ...
customer_reviews.text: So funny! We wanted a cool board game for our family and came across this. It’s very fun for all ages! My siblings and I are from 20 - 30 and out parents are almost in their 60’s yet we all had no problem getting the answers.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game!
customer_reviews.text: Easy/quick to learn. People quickly discover that timing of an answer is important depending on the clues given!
customer_reviews.author: M. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GAME!
customer_reviews.text: This game was really easy to learn and so much fun when playing with family. Everyone can pretty much play but it could be a little harder for kids that are under the age of 14. Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: daynadoo

customer_reviews.title: Fantabulous!!!
customer_reviews.text: We all played this game five minutes after it was unwrapped at Christmas! It's great! I don't think we laughed so hard in years! Plus, all the trivia happened to be the "useless information" that my brain seems to soak up like a dry sponge! So I was actually able to move away from Start. Unlike that homo game "Tr*v*al Pers*it" where they want to know what shade of green George Washington's third arterial molar was on the fifth set of false teeth he bought but never wore. Or some stupid question about the neighbor of some extra on the set of some obscure 1050's movie's dog. Great fun!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good fun for teenagers on up!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband for Christmas from his daughters. We played it for new years eve with teenagers and it was a big hit! Didn't take too long and was fun for 13 year old to 49 year old. We played it again with family on the next weekend and again it was a blast. This is a game where you can't play just one round. We always end up with going at least two before we can switch. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andi Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Love this game!
customer_reviews.text: Has questions for all age groups to be able to have a chance to win. I play with my 3 teens and my 10 years, always fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun but plays out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Fun game! Seemed to go by quickly but we just went around the board twice. Some questions are hard but I enjoy the challenge. I look forward to getting an extension pack of questions.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Atchison

customer_reviews.title: A fun, brainy game
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun (if you like trivia games), especially when stuck inside. We had fun just using the cards without keeping track of who was winning. (I wouldn’t have known enough when I was a kid to enjoy this so definitely a game for people over 20, 30?
customer_reviews.author: ChrisAOC

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: It is a gift and it arrived damaged. I’m mad bc the replacement won’t get here till after Christmas. So I have to keep the broken one
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Decent trivia game
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple trivia game. Decent questions, but the game is very short. It only takes a few turns for someone to win, so we often just use the questions to play our own game.
customer_reviews.author: Momanon

customer_reviews.title: Fun trivia game!
customer_reviews.text: We had a blast playing this game on New Year's Eve with a group of six adults ranging from 27-55. Questions ranged from easy to impossible with most being in between.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo6

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for the whole fam. Some questions are super easy but some really hard so for a smaller child it might be too challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Easy80

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game. My family loves trivia games and we wanted to try something new. It’s really easy to learn and it’s offered at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Hawke

customer_reviews.title: Barely so-so
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why everyone liked this game so much. I typically like trivia type games, but this one was boring. I was a bit disappointed in trying to corral my teenaged boys to play this. They thought it was lame too.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and fun questions
customer_reviews.text: If you are impatient and hate going in turns to answer trivia questions, this game is for you because anyone can answer questions except during Hardass questions which are for the dice roller only. I had a blast playing 4-5 rounds of this with just a group of 3 players. I believe you should get at least have 5 or 6 players for a lengthy/challenging game. If you have a smaller group of players 3 or even 4, the game seems to go faster considering the amount of spaces on the board. If you are game board collector this game is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Vick Katoch

customer_reviews.title: Great party game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun. I belong to a girls game night group and took this as a new game to introduce. Everyone loved it. It says 2-6 players, but we played it with 8 and just added extra playing pieces. (We used two different colored teddy bear erasers.) The questions were fun, some not too hard, some very challenging. Would definitely recommend this game for all!
customer_reviews.author: A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This game is great and is always a top choice at game nights
customer_reviews.text: This game is great and is always a top choice at game nights. Most fun when played with at least 5 people, just so you have some competition and funky, fun, wrong answers.
customer_reviews.author: Dannie

customer_reviews.title: So fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trivia game. The game board has penalty spaces that when you land on them you can't answer the next question. This is a fun twist that sometimes levels the playing field if you're playing with a future Jeopardy contestant like my dad! It's pretty versatile for groups, too. Some games work better with larger or smaller groups. We've played this with a variety of groups and had a blast each time. This is also designed to be a pretty quick game, so time isn't an issue. Overall a great game. We really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina B.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game on a whim - the name amused me, and the premise of the game sounded fun. And was I right! I've played it several times with different friends, and everyone so far has enjoyed it. It's like trivial pursuit, only not nearly as difficult. My one complaint is that it's a very short game. Most games lasted 15-20 minutes (with a group of 5, it would probably last longer with more people - but definitely a great multi-person game!) The longest game might have lasted 30 minutes or so, but average is quite a bit shorter. We found the "hard" questions to generally be much easier than the general questions.
customer_reviews.author: Emily M.

customer_reviews.title: We all laughed so hard playing this game
customer_reviews.text: We had a blast playing this game at the beach. Our family laughed so hard! Great for small groups.
customer_reviews.author: Ann C

customer_reviews.title: So excited for this white elephant gift
customer_reviews.text: This was totally bought as a joking gift. cant want to see the reaction when they open it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a lot of fun with this game. Played with ages 15 to 60, everyone loved it! I like that the questions aren't geared to one age group. It doesn't take a long time to play a round. One of our new favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Family fun!
customer_reviews.text: Smart A** is a fun, light trivia game with a lot of laughs for ages 12 and up. It's great for game nights and parties!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Alvarisi

customer_reviews.title: Not what you think.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the title fool you. We were pleasantly surprised when good friends brought this over for game night. It is a fast moving game that is actually educational in my opinion. I have loved learning about the who's, what's. and where's involved in this game. Now some of them are quite easy to guess but some of the cards have facts on it that I have never heard of before (that is the point) and it has been a load of fun playing this. We had to buy it as soon as we were done with the first game with our friends. Great family or adult game!
customer_reviews.author: Kierra Theurer

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this game to play as a family. Our kids are 12+ and this game is really fun!
customer_reviews.author: K. Short

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game for trivia nuts. We had all ages playing it and everybody had a really good time.
customer_reviews.author: M A Sletten

customer_reviews.title: The game has so few cards that it is easily memorized. Having played the game just a few ...
customer_reviews.text: The game has so few cards that it is easily memorized. Having played the game just a few times, my 11 year old niece new answers just by memorization. Maybe she is a smart ass...but the game needs additional cards. Too few cards to really make the game even challenging.
customer_reviews.author: glezgirl

customer_reviews.title: Fun Laughs and Smarty pants.
customer_reviews.text: This game is a very good Family Game Night game, my kids loved it , its the only time they get to say "the word". The trivia questions were not too hard yet some made you really think, tons of laughs and good Fun!
customer_reviews.author: LaTanya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the smart ass in your group of friends.
customer_reviews.text: The game is pretty fun for all levels of players. Some questions benefit the “less savvy” players and some benefit the “smart ass” . It’s a good game.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: fun game
customer_reviews.text: super fun game but you can only play it once, then you know all the answers
customer_reviews.author: Seasoned mommy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it was
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game thinking it was going to be fun. Bleh. It's basically Trivial Pursuit.
customer_reviews.author: S. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Great party game!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! It is a trivia game that is fast paced, and not so hard that you have to be a genius to do well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesi Lea Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. Questions are a bit difficult but we realized we have learned from playing.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L. Page

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun
customer_reviews.text: this is a fun game! It is a trivia game combined with a board. Get a right answer and you move around the board to the finish line and declared the smart ass
customer_reviews.author: lynn m

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to play!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas and he really enjoyed it. Play with my nephews if different ages and they had a blast!
customer_reviews.author: Patti Fuss

customer_reviews.title: Really fun Trivia Game
customer_reviews.text: We have had this game for almost a week now in the house. I bought it on Amazon just because of the name. My kids have had so much fun playing this game. We have played it four times in the last week. We never Know who the SMART ASS in the house is going to be. I recommend this game for kids ages 10-Adult.
customer_reviews.author: Carole V. Workman

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun
customer_reviews.text: My friends and I always look forward to playing this game, and love to introduce it to others. It's not chess, but it's a lot of uncomplicated fun :)
customer_reviews.author: Bijou noir

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun trivia game! Also a better price than other stores - and it shipped directly to my home.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! I love that the trivia is varied enough for so many different types of people.
customer_reviews.author: Brhyde

customer_reviews.title: Perfect party game
customer_reviews.text: Hilariously awesome fun. Learn great trivia and have a good time doing it.
customer_reviews.author: rockymtngrl1

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Play with kids &/or adults. Quick to start/play/finish.
customer_reviews.text: This game is a blast both with family of all ages (8-100)...but super enjoyable to play with adults. What’s great is you can play a quick round in 15-20 minutes or extend it to an evening of entertainment. Looking for something easy fun and quick to start and finish...give Smart Ass a go.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzlingmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 adults + 3 teens from 13 to 17. Everyone enjoys the game, though I do screen out some cards(a lot have references to movies, public figures that the kids would not know). I also sometimes play by the rule that the adults can not guess until clue #3--just to even the playing field a bit. It would be great if the cards were sorted a bit by age range, just so we can easily focus on those that the kids have a shot of knowing. Alas, they do not know who Fred Astaire is (well, they do know....). Love the variety of topics.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn K

customer_reviews.title: Great game and packaging
customer_reviews.text: Fun educational game to play with parents and older kids at least 13+. Quality product and packaging. Great for families and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my jewelry parties for winning gifts. Was a lot of fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN
customer_reviews.text: Played this with my mom and brother on our vacation trip. We all loved it. Very fun.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Brendan Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Fun lively. A mix a knowledge and luck.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15 year old grandson on his birthday. Family hit with his age and up. 12 and 13 year olds tired early and would want to quit. Most requested family game for teens to old folks.
customer_reviews.author: NANA

product_meta.title: University Games Smart Ass The Ultimate Trivia Board Game for Families & Adults Ages 12 & Up, The Perfect Tabletop Game For Parties & Events, Model:1360
product_meta.description: Who’s the Smart Ass among your friends and family? Find out with this outrageous, fast-paced party game. Each question has eight clues. The first player to yell out the correct answer wins the round and takes a step closer to being the ultimate Smart Ass. No specific knowledge base is required, so even a Dumb Ass can win!
feature_bullets: Play Smart Ass, the game where it's OK to yell out the answer, even when it's not your turn
Be the first to answer the Who, What, and Where Am I questions, and move closer to being the ultimate Smart Ass
A fast-paced party game for 2 - 6 players, ages 12 and up
Includes game board, 6 playing pieces and stands, 411 question cards, 2 jumbo dice, and instructions
New Edition: All New Questions in 2017

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
